comment.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qv5awtI9tzw&t=10s](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DQv5awtI9tzw%26t%3D10s) ### Comment > Adguard appears to work once, if I am lucky. After that once, it does not appear to work at all. Every subsequent window or tab I open in Youtube has ads. Often the video will not run, it is stopped on the first part of an ad. This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Please test these rules (one rule per line):

```
svethardware.cz#%#//scriptlet("set-constant", "isRABDisplayed", "true")
svethardware.cz#%#//scriptlet("set-constant", "isAdblock", "false")
```
If not working, add this one:
`svethardware.cz#%#//scriptlet("set-constant", "isAdblockOn", "noopFunc")`

And this one, if previous not working:
`svethardware.cz#%#//scriptlet("set-constant", "limitArticleChars", "noopFunc")`

comment.body:
As I can see, this rule only applies to one script. Do you have the same?
If so, it's better to do a more specific rule like this.
```adblock
||soft98.ir/templates/*/js/jquery.min.packed.js$replace=/clipPath/filter/
```

oduct_store_id%3D%26ds_url_v%3D2%26ds_dest_url%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252F8808.xg4ken.com%252Ftrk%252Fv1%253Fprof%253D413%26camp%3D8221%26kct%3Dgoogle%26kchid%3D2704723172%26criteriaid%3Dpla-2054630044774%26campaignid%3D12455790129%26locphy%3D9027306%26adgroupid%3D118077110763%26adpos%3D%26cid%3D503118727086%26networkType%3D%26kdv%3Dm%26kext%3D%26kadtype%3D%26kmc%3D8740%26kpid%3D324764220%26url%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwww.homedepot.com%252Fp%252FRYOBI-ONE-HP-18V-Brushless-Edger-Tool-Only-P2302BTL%252F324764220%253Fg_store%253D%26source%3Dshoppingads%26locale%3Den-US%26mtc%3DSHOPPING-BF-CDP-GGL-D28I-028_032_PORTABLE-NA-NA-NA-SMART-NA-NA-NA-NA-NBR-NA-NA-NA-SMART_SHP%26cm_mmc%3DSHOPPING-BF-CDP-GGL-D28I-028_032_PORTABLE-NA-NA-NA-SMART-NA-NA-NA-NA-NBR-NA-NA-NA-SMART_SHP-71700000080837630-58700006820161822-92700076368169372%26gclsrc%3Daw.ds%26gbraid%3D0AAAAADq61Uc79Oc4n0l_QhX9QZ8w4e__b%26gclid%3DCjwKCAjws7WkBhBFEiwAIi1686cEKR5F--Ul-R6RdNI51J0sBm5PNhdR1Zc7Jlv8-nlXXWahYS6qThoCBKoQAvD_BwE) ### Comment > Whenever, Ad Guard is enabled, whenever I’m searching Google for any specific product and the product appears as a “sponsored” ad, 90% of the time whenever I click on the product that I’m actually trying to find it will not allow me to open the page unless I disable AdGuard and then click it. > > I have attempted to add several variations of the add double click URL to the allow list, but never works. A quick Google search keeps leading me to how to enable AB blocking for other issues, but not how to allow meI have attempted to add several variations of the “ad.double click.” URL to the allow list, but never works. Also the other blocked url “https://clickserve.dartsearch.net”, still no success. > A quick Google search keeps leading me to how to ENABLE Adblocking for other issues, but not how to allow or (disable whatever filter that’s preventing my google search from opening the product I’m trying to locate). > > This issue isn’t isolated to home depot (or links that open other apps), pretty much any product I search for… which typically is successful in appearing in the first few of the “sponsored“ Google ads.. unless I go and disable AdGuard as a whole, I can’t actually go to the freaking page. I am specifically attempting to go to. > If there’s any assistance that somebody’s found, please let me know. Thank you for the time. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/PaWsEtB.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/gAemXzI.jpg)
Screenshot 3 ![Screenshot 3](https://reports-img.adguard.com/wYCbqoG.png)
Screenshot 4 ![Screenshot 4](https://reports-img.adguard.com/xsmJeBX.jpg)

AdGuard Mobile Ads,
EasyList Other extensions used: | Tried disabling, safari pop-up blocker that’s built-in to the phone browser. The only way I can get a product that I’m searching via Google is to actually turn off Ad Guard mobile.

issue.title: GoodbyeAds Spotify
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jerryn70/GoodbyeAds/master/Extension/GoodbyeAds-Spotify-AdBlock.txt

Hi there,

Would you please consider adding GoodbyeAds Spotify to your lists/hosts?

This can reduce Spotify ads and it does not break the app/website.

Thank you.

### Proposed solution

Add this blocklist to your free DNS service.

### Additional information

_No response_
